summary: The Pit River Land Transfer Act of 2025 proposes to take approximately 583.79 acres of federal land in California, known as the Four Corners Federal land, into trust for the benefit of the Pit River Tribe. The bill transfers administrative jurisdiction from the Secretary of Agriculture to the Secretary of the Interior for this land. The land will be considered part of the Tribe's Reservation and administered under the laws applicable to trust lands. Gaming is prohibited on the transferred land.  A survey of the land is required within 180 days of enactment.
